Sounds like you got bit by the popular management (and programmer, 
unfortunately) idea that you "save time" by not testing your code. :(

You care, and the developers care.  That's an important first step.

You did have a working test harness at one point, right?  How about 
starting by fixing that?  Make whatever changes are needed to the 
code/tests to get the existing tests to run again.  And as a matter of 
policy, require all NEW code to have unit tests.  This won't cure the 
disease, but it will at least stop it from getting any worse.  Then 
start adding tests for every *bug* you find, or have already found but 
haven't fixed yet.

You won't have complete coverage this way, and may never get there, but 
at least you'll be carrying forward good practices.  And if you can 
demonstrate to management that your development is now severely slowed 
by bugs due to a lack of testing, you may be able to convince them.
